content.content: Key Info Delegate Address: 0x925016C2367802632cABDF13b5FC2C1BDC2c301a Forum: @HKUST_EPI_BLOCKCHAIN Discord: @HKUST-EPI Email (optional): [email protected] External Website (optional): EPI Lab Meet Your Delegate Video (optional): N/A  Core Values  To develop and promote a mutually beneficial and friendly environment between Universities and Protocols in the Decentralised Finance space To promote critical thinking and unique thought process to derive solutions To educate the benefits integration of blockchain technology to traditional finance to the next generation of workforce To share insights, industry knowledge and experiences to protocol stakeholders To provide advice and support on matters involving Treasury, Budgeting, Process Streamlining and Collateral risk Management to the protocol   Delegate Statement In Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST), the visions and ideas which new technologies are developed from should be embraced and nurtured. Students are encouraged to explore and trailblaze on any potential new frontiers. As blockchain technology is still maturing and adoption is rapidly increasing, continuous education and development should be established. For mainstream adoption to be achieved, strategic planning as well as proper decision making and marketing is required. Therefore, by establishing a research lab (EPI) to synergise the growth of MakerDAO, by governance participation, with the exposure to blockchain technology and decentralised finance, this would provide a mutually beneficial symbiotic relationship between MakerDAO and the University. The delegator will be led by a University researcher with student volunteers (Research lab), the research lab is expected to be fully vested in the governance of MakerDAO and communications with delegators will be communicated on a frequent and timely basis. The research lab will be solely responsible for Governance matters to MakerDAO with assistance from other Faculty members on other matters such as, Research, Education, Business Development and Web3 developments. HKUST-EPI has plans to participate in governance matters in other protocols. This research lab will share updates regarding new proposals internally and will discuss them before reaching a decisive vote. This decision making process will take place internally via simple majority either in person or via electronic communication mediums. Decisions will be made in time to ascertain full participation in the governance proposals. The governance initiatives are:  Active participation in discussion forums Initiating new improvements proposals Monitoring of news and updates Seek consultations with respective faculty members or with collaborating external parties Communication with internal team members Open communications and Q&A with delegators when time permits  HKUST-EPI sincerely encourages all MakerDAO stakeholders to delegate with the research lab to have a greater stake and voting power in the decision making process. By leveraging on our resources and connections to bring the protocol to greater glory. With our research lab of individuals with unique perspectives, industry experience and knowledge, rest assured that the choice of delegating with HKUSE-EPI, as your preferred recognized delegate, will be a positive experience.  Conflicts of Interest  Team members may have small stake in MakerDAO Consultations with other teams in charge of governance of other protocols Consultations with external collaborators  HKUST-EPI has read and agreed to abide by the Delegate Code of Conduct.  Waiver of liability By delegating to Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, you acknowledge and agree that Hong Kong University of Science and Technology will participate on a best efforts basis and will not be liable for any form of damages related to participation in the Maker Protocol, or MakerDAO.
content.GPT-summary: The post is an explanation of the HKUST EPI Blockchain Delegate Platform proposal. The author explains the core values, delegate statement, governance initiatives, conflicts of interest, and waiver of liability. The post also extends an invitation to MakerDAO stakeholders to delegate with the research lab and collaborate with HKUST-EPI. A 3rd party gives entirely positive feedback on the proposal and provides constructive criticism.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: Interesting, this is the first time seeing an educational institution from Asia participating as a Maker delegate and we sincerely welcome more diversity in the delegate ecosystem.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: Great to see more universities joining the delegate group! Looking forward to seeing your thoughts and feel free to reach out for discussions and collaborations.

content.content: Approve One-time MKR Distribution to Correct CES-001 Incentive Program Shortfall We voted YES, as it is only fair to provide the funds as proper remuneration to the affected team members. Confirm Trial Deployment of DssKiln We voted to support a 0.5M burn, as we view that the burning of MKR is beneficial to the existing MKR holders by returning some value back to the MKR holders by the protocol. As well as, providing certain confidence to them regarding the MAKER protocol. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal We voted YES to the poll to change the parameters:  WSTETH-B - Increase in stability fees will bring more revenue to the protocol. Inline with the end game plan to amass a store of StETH, beneficial to start charging a fee to borrow against it. In addition, we view that with an increasing stability fee imposed to the vaults would be a barrier to borrowers to maintain large positions. hence reducing overall risk to the vault during a crash in asset prices. D3M - Reactivation or increase in the D3M parameters will again bring more revenue to the protocol and it will be beneficial to utilise the short term rally in the market to increase these revenues. USDP - Increase of the entry borrowing fee would be beneficial to deter short term borrowers as the barrier of entry has been adjusted upwards.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match.

content.content: Adjust the GUSD PSM Debt Ceiling  We decided to vote for the decrease of the GUSD PSM to 0DAI  The backing of the GUSD is unsecured and undetermined if it will be impacted by the Gemini Earn issue and investigations with the DOJ and SEC. Silvergate is also a bank used by Gemini which has been in a liquidity crunch due to a bank run. Hence, there is a risk to whether the FDIC will step in to insure the collateral. We expect this to be highly unlikely.    Decrease GUSD PSM Fee Out (tout)  We voted YES  To encourage frictionless closure of GUSD positions    Ratification Poll for MIP63 Maker Keeper Network Amendment  We support the poll to change the parameters:  The clarification of the MIP63 documentation will lower the risk of any errors or unwanted issues when onboarding any new Keep Networks to maintain certain functions of the protocol.    Ratification Poll for Defense Fund (MIP55c3-SP14)  We voted NO  As we view that imposing a reimbursing fund like this will encourage litigation to CUs and Delegates. Hence depleting the funds at an accelerated rate. Therefore, reserves will be depleted if frequent top-ups are performed.    Ratification Poll for Onboard PSM USDC to Yearn to earn Yield (MIP92)  We voted YES  The increase in revenue will be beneficial to MAKER, but the risk from smart contracts interactions and various possible attacks (oracles and flashloans, etc) should be assessed. the strategy with the bespoke vault need to be scrutinised as well, as no concrete strategy has been shared to the forums.    Ratification Poll for Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults (MIP13c3-SP13)  We voted YES  We agree that the RWA requires a dedicated CU to monitor the deliverables and contractual obligations from the RWA arrangers or counterparties. As MAKER will be subjected to asymmetrical information due to any lapses in the obligations of the counterparty. We eagerly await the applicants and their budget requests.    Ratification Poll for Onboard-Amend Keeper Network - Chainlink Automation (MIP63c4-SP5)  We voted YES  We view having Chainlink as a Keeper Network to provide maintenance for simple task for MAKER to be beneficial to the protocol. Voted parameters and updates on Oracles can be performed on a more timely basis using Chainlink as the form of automation.    Ratification Poll for Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster (MIP55c3-SP13)  We voted NO  We agree that performance of all RWAs should be tracked and monitored including their submission of the contractual deliverables. But monitoring should not be siloed and should be covering all RWAs.    Ratification Poll for Commercial Risk and Legal Domain Work to Support SF-001 Expanded Mandate Related to RWAs (MIP55c3-SP12)  We voted YES  We view that monitoring RWA is in urgent need. Strategic finance fits the role and has the skills to perform such matters on the entire RWA portfolio of the protocol.    Ratification Poll for Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund IS-001 from Dec 2022 to May 2023 (MIP14c2-SP2)  We voted YES  We view that the request for 43k for a 6months runway for the CU to operate is within reasonable means. Where the CU will transit into a METAdao which is excitingly inline with the Endgame plan.    Ratification Poll for Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to fund TechOps CU for February 2023 (MIP14c2-SP1)  We voted YES  We view that the request for 139k for a 2 months runway for the CU to operate is within reasonable means. We look forward to assessing the revised budget in March 2023.    Ratification Poll for Core Unit Offboarding (COM-001) (MIP39c3-SP7)  We appreciate the efforts of the CU in providing bridging information from the various CUs and other governance members to the community.  We support the CU preferred parachute amounts.    Ratification Poll for Remove MIP14c4 (Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling) (MIP4c2-SP32)  We support the endgame plan and we recognise that the limit is an issue.  Removing this issue allows for fund requests to be disbursed in a more timely manner.    Ratification Poll for Obsolete MIP Removal (MIP23, MIP28) (MIP4c4-SP3)  We agree that the MIPs are obsolete. It is appreciated to have regular housekeeping of MIPs.  Ratification Poll for MIP14 Repeal (MIP4c4-SP2)  We disagree that the MIP14 is obsolete. The procedure and limits should be in place for the foreseeable future when more fund request will be performed for METADAOs and other protocol related functions and operations. The limits should be removed to cater for the increase in market rate for remuneration and expenses.  Ratification Poll for Amend MIP51 to Remove MIP51c4 (Calendar Exceptions) (MIP4c2-SP28)  We disagree with removing MIP51c4.  We understand that there is diversity in the community and more people can cover each other’s tasks. As December has multiple holidays we believe individuals who do not partake in the festive cheers do utilise this time to relax or visit their family. It is only fair for them to be able to do so. Nonetheless, should any emergencies arise, urgent executive polling is always available.    Ratification Poll for Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics (MIP4c2-SP29)  We agree with the ratification on both issues  Abstaining votes serve no purpose and benefit to the governance. View to be low effort delegates and leeching the funds from the protocol. Executive votes are important and voting power should be based on participation.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match

content.content: Offboarding Parameters for USDC-A, USDP-A, and GUSD-A  We voted YES  As the poll was passed to remove these legacy vaults, hence these parameters need to be changed to expedite the deprecation of these legacy vaults.    Adjust the Debt Floor (dust)  We voted Option 2 - Limited Reduction,  Opportunity for the protocol to generate more revenue is a plus This should be done in a more controlled manner and not in leaps

content.content: Update the Multisig Managing the Velodrome NFT  We voted YES  The candidates are of good caliber and this procedure is standard practice to replace a resignee.    PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal  We voted YES  Stability fees adjustments should allow more participants to enter. Debt ceiling adjustments should allo DAI to remain competitive in this market situation AAVE D3M reactivation will help with the interest rate being lowered to attract more borrowers

content.content: Ratification Poll for Restart a daily $100 Micro-Burn of MKR in Show of Good Faith to MKR Holders (MIP74c1-SP1)  We voted NO  The impact to the MKR price should be minimal and insignificant.    Ratification Poll - Declaration of Intent - Implement a Feature to Refund People who Lost Money Sending Dai to the Dai Contract Address (MIP13c3-SP14)  We voted NO  Does not make sense for the Protocol to “rescue” individuals whom made mistakes.    Ratification Poll for Amend MIP62 to Allow for Changing Communication Responsibilities (MIP4c2-SP33)  We voted YES  Gov Comms has been offboarded and documentation has to be updated accordingly.    Ratification Poll for Amend Interim Facilitator Appointment Process (MIP4c2-SP30)  We voted YES  Despite the increase in centralised discussion making, this compromise is justified to promote business continuity planning ASAP.    Ratification Poll for $100M of Cogent Bank Loan Participations (MIP95)  We voted NO  Timing of this RWA investment was requested at a bad time when the SEC is cracking down on stablecoins. Uncertainty of the scrutiny on USDC and if mass withdrawals would occur, lead to premature unwinding of RWA investments.

content.content: Audit and Review Work for Phoenix Labs Engineering Resource for Phoenix Labs  We voted YES for both  Despite having planned away from the community’s view. Sparkz Protocol will be greatly beneficial to MAKER by means of having greater utilisation for DAI.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match

content.content: PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal  We voted YES  Interest increase is in line with the global trend of increasing rates, due to the fed’s stance of lowering inflation. AAVE and COMPOUND have increased their rates accordingly, and Maker is performing a reactionary change. Debt ceiling increases are viable and understandable due to market conditions:  D3M modules increased to sustain a 2-3% borrowing rate to remain competitive. YFI due to the utilisation of of the pool has reached its peak. rETH due to the lower stability rates compared to other staked ETH vaults, prepare for more borrowers.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match.

content.content: Short Ratification Poll for Phoenix Labs Initial Funding (MIP55c3-SP15)  We voted YES  SPF was already approved, hence disbursement of funds as at this juncture is reasonable in order to proceed with the advancement of the development of the protocol.    Decrease the RETH-A Dust Parameter  We voted YES  The reduction in the minimum borrowable DAI from the RETH vaults will encourage greater utilisation and more protocol revenue.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match. The comment does not relate to the summary provided.

content.content: Emergency Parameter Changes - March 11, 2023  We voted for the executive actions to be made, but the stance held is to restrict any additional exposure to USDC by pausing the PSM or only allowing an outflow of USDC. If not possible, lower the debt ceiling and the daily debt ceiling increments.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match.

content.content: Remove the DC-IAM from MIP65 (RWA007-A) & Increase the MIP65 (RWA007-A) Debt Ceiling  We voted NO  In light of certain discussions regarding confusion in the reporting/answering hierarchy for RWA007, we view this should be delayed from a risk perspective until the matters are rectified and clarified.    Return Excess MIP65 Funds to Surplus Buffer  We voted YES  No reason to disagree for more liquidity inflow from centralised sources    Short Ratification Poll for Vault Setting Amendment Subproposal (MIP92c5-SP1)  We voted NO  Though these are decentralised strategies, no estimated APY was provided and how Yearn can value add to the strategies. The strategies are generally simple and Maker can accomplish them independently.

content.content: Ratification Poll for the Constitution MIP Set  We voted YES  For now we will agree to the constitution, but we will always keep point 11 in mind if matters in the constitution needs to be amended.    Ratification Poll for Onboarding Retro as CES-001 Facilitator  We voted YES  No issues with the conversion.    Ratification Poll for Phoenix Labs - Spark Lend Launch (SPF)  We voted YES  The budget was already approved judging by the progress if factual, funds will be required to meet the April launch.    Ratification Poll for D3M to Spark Lend (MIP116)  We voted NO  To be clear we do not disagree on the deployment of fund to the D3M test module for Spark. Disagreement is the quantum of the funds being requested for a test system is deemed unreasonable and just being prudent.    Ratification Poll for Expand Facilitator Definition to Allow Entities  We voted YES  The definition is better defined and we are agreeable to the changes.    Ratification Poll for Risk Facilitator Onboarding (RISK-001) & Ratification Poll for Protocol Engineering Facilitator Onboarding (MIP41c4-SP42)  We voted YES  We are supportive to the assignment of the parties to the position.    Ratification Poll for Starknet CU Budget Extension (SNE-001)  We voted YES  Budget extension is reasonable, if target is missed for Q1 2023 more stringent assessment will be undertaken to deem their validity in the matter.    Ratification Poll for Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to fund TechOps CU for March 2023 (MIP14c2-SP5)  We voted YES  This is the last extension we will be agreeing to, no further extension will be voted for if the budget is not out for governance approval.    Ratification Poll for Modifying Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit Mandate - SAS-001 (MIP39c2-SP39)  We voted YES  No argument with an expanded scope, but time will time on the relevance of the deliverables.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match.
